skill.name: fda-consultant-specialist

Provides FDA pathway expertise, QSR compliance, cybersecurity guidance, and regulatory submission support. Use for FDA submission planning, QSR compliance assessments, HIPAA evaluations, and FDA regulatory strategy development.

security_audit.summary: All 49 static findings are false positives. The 'Weak cryptographic algorithm' detections were triggered by FDA regulatory references (21 CFR 820, 510(k), PMA) in documentation. The 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' detections were triggered by markdown tree diagram characters (├──, │, └──) used for visual hierarchy. The 'Hardcoded URL' is legitimate GitHub repository metadata. This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code or malicious content.

content.value_statement: Medical device companies face complex FDA regulations and HIPAA requirements. This skill provides expert guidance on 510(k) submissions, QSR compliance, and healthcare data protection for efficient market access.
actual_capabilities: Guide 510(k) and PMA submission preparation and strategy
Assess Quality System Regulation (QSR) 21 CFR 820 compliance
Evaluate HIPAA requirements for medical devices handling PHI
Develop FDA regulatory pathway strategies for device classification
Prepare FDA inspection readiness and warning letter responses
limitations: Cannot submit documents directly to FDA or access FDA databases
Does not provide legal advice or replace regulatory counsel
Cannot perform actual audits or certifications
Guidance is based on published regulations, not real-time FDA communications

use_cases.title: Plan regulatory strategy
use_cases.description: Determine optimal FDA pathway and prepare 510(k) submission plan for new device market entry

use_cases.title: Assess QSR compliance
use_cases.description: Evaluate quality system documentation against 21 CFR 820 requirements and identify gaps

use_cases.title: Implement HIPAA safeguards
use_cases.description: Verify technical and administrative safeguards for devices handling protected health information

prompt_templates.title: Pathway analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my medical device and recommend the optimal FDA regulatory pathway. Device function: [description], intended use: [purpose], risk class: [I/II/III]

prompt_templates.title: 510(k) preparation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 510(k) submission checklist for my [device type] targeting substantial equivalence to predicate [device name]. Include required sections and testing requirements.

prompt_templates.title: QSR assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess our QMS documentation against 21 CFR 820 requirements. Focus on design controls (820.30) and CAPA procedures (820.100). Identify compliance gaps.

prompt_templates.title: HIPAA review
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate our medical device data flows for HIPAA compliance. Device handles [data types] and connects to [systems]. Recommend technical safeguards and documentation needed.

output_examples.input: Guide our Class II device through 510(k) submission for ECG monitoring
output: Predicates to consider: FDA-cleared ECG devices with similar indication
Key sections: Device description, indications for use, substantial equivalence comparison
Testing required: Electrical safety, performance testing, software validation

output_examples.input: Assess our design control documentation for compliance gaps
output: Design input documentation: Needs update to include usability requirements
Design verification: Missing protocol for [specific component]
Design validation: Consider clinical evaluation report update
Action items: 3 high-priority gaps, 2 medium-priority improvements

best_practices: Start regulatory strategy early in product development to avoid costly redesigns
Maintain documented rationale for all predicate device comparisons and testing decisions
Integrate FDA requirements into design controls from initial concept phase
anti_patterns: Assuming 510(k) pathway without proper substantial equivalence analysis
Waiting until late stages to address HIPAA data protection requirements
Treating FDA guidance as optional rather than regulatory requirements

faq.question: What is the difference between 510(k) and PMA?
faq.answer: 510(k) demonstrates substantial equivalence to predicate devices. PMA requires clinical evidence of safety and effectiveness for higher-risk devices.

faq.question: How long does FDA 510(k) submission take?
faq.answer: Average FDA review is 90 days. Total timeline including preparation is typically 6-12 months depending on device complexity.

faq.question: Does this skill replace regulatory consultants?
faq.answer: No. It provides guidance and frameworks. Complex submissions should involve qualified regulatory professionals and legal counsel.

faq.question: What devices require HIPAA compliance?
faq.answer: Devices that create, store, or transmit protected health information (PHI) must implement HIPAA safeguards and documentation.

faq.question: Can this help with FDA inspections?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides inspection readiness frameworks, documentation checklists, and warning letter response strategies.

faq.question: What FDA regulations apply to SaMD?
faq.answer: Software as Medical Device follows same pathways (510(k)/PMA) with additional software lifecycle documentation and cybersecurity requirements.
